quote: You have power over your mind, not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: If it is not right, do not do it; if it is not true, do not say it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: It’s not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
author: Epictetus

quote: No man is free who is not master of himself.
author: Epictetus

quote: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
author: Epictetus

quote: If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.
author: Epictetus

quote: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
author: Seneca

quote: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
author: Seneca

quote: He suffers more than necessary, who suffers before it is necessary.
author: Seneca

quote: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.
author: Seneca

quote: No man was ever wise by chance.
author: Seneca

quote: Man conquers the world by conquering himself.
author: Zeno of Citium

quote: Practice yourself, for heaven’s sake, in little things, and then proceed to greater.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: Difficulty shows what men are.
author: Epictetus

quote: A person’s worth is measured by the worth of what he values.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The best answer to anger is silence.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Be tolerant with others and strict with yourself.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Today I escaped anxiety. Or no, I discarded it, because it was within me, in my own perceptions—not outside.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: When someone does you wrong, you should consider what judgment led them to do so.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Reject your sense of injury and the injury itself disappears.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Don’t be overheard complaining… not even to yourself.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it happens.
author: Epictetus

quote: Circumstances don’t make the man, they only reveal him to himself.
author: Epictetus

quote: He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.
author: Epictetus

quote: Only the educated are free.
author: Epictetus

quote: If someone speaks ill of you, do not defend yourself but reply: 'He obviously didn’t know the rest of my faults, or he would not have mentioned only these.'
author: Epictetus

quote: No great thing is created suddenly.
author: Epictetus

quote: We are not disturbed by things, but by the views we take of things.
author: Epictetus

quote: Attach yourself to what is spiritually superior.
author: Epictetus

quote: Control your passions lest they take control of you.
author: Epictetus

quote: Sometimes even living is an act of courage.
author: Seneca

quote: To be everywhere is to be nowhere.
author: Seneca

quote: It is a rough road that leads to the heights of greatness.
author: Seneca

quote: While we wait for life, life passes.
author: Seneca

quote: Associate with people who are likely to improve you.
author: Seneca

quote: We become wiser by adversity.
author: Seneca

quote: He who is brave is free.
author: Seneca

quote: A gem cannot be polished without friction, nor a man without trials.
author: Seneca

quote: Life is long if you know how to use it.
author: Seneca

quote: Hang on to your useful enthusiasms.
author: Seneca

quote: All the good are free, all the bad are slaves.
author: Epictetus

quote: Appearances to the mind are of four kinds. These are things as they are, things as they appear to be, things neither as they are nor as they appear, and things both as they are and as they appear.
author: Epictetus

quote: Nothing great is created suddenly, any more than a bunch of grapes or a fig.
author: Epictetus

quote: He who has great power should use it lightly.
author: Seneca

quote: Most powerful is he who has himself in his own power.
author: Seneca

quote: If a man knows not to which port he sails, no wind is favorable.
author: Seneca

quote: To wish to be well is a part of becoming well.
author: Seneca

quote: Fortune falls heavily on those for whom she’s unexpected.
author: Seneca

quote: He who fears death will never do anything worthy of a living man.
author: Seneca

quote: We must indulge the mind and from time to time allow it the leisure which is its food and strength.
author: Seneca

quote: Well-being is attained by little and little, and nevertheless it is no little thing itself.
author: Zeno of Citium

quote: Better to trip with the feet than with the tongue.
author: Zeno of Citium

quote: All things are in flux; you cannot step into the same river twice.
author: Heraclitus

quote: Character is destiny.
author: Heraclitus

quote: There is nothing permanent except change.
author: Heraclitus

quote: No one is ever unhappy because of someone else.
author: Epictetus

quote: Nothing is ours except time.
author: Seneca

quote: The part of life we really live is small. For all the rest of existence is not life, but merely time.
author: Seneca

quote: We should not trust the masses who say only the free can be educated, but rather trust the philosophers who say only the educated are free.
author: Epictetus

quote: Receive without pride, let go without attachment.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Do every act of your life as though it were the last.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The universe is change; our life is what our thoughts make it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Remember: no one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
author: Epictetus

quote: If you seek truth, you will not seek victory by dishonorable means.
author: Epictetus

quote: Be so busy improving yourself that you have no time to criticize others.
author: Epictetus

quote: Whatever can happen at any time can happen today.
author: Seneca

quote: If you judge, investigate.
author: Seneca

quote: Wherever there is a human being, there is an opportunity for kindness.
author: Seneca

quote: Nothing is burdensome if taken lightly, and nothing light if taken burdensomely.
author: Seneca

quote: Wisdom listens; ignorance speaks.
author: Heraclitus

quote: Dogs bark at what they do not understand.
author: Heraclitus

quote: No one can escape pain, but each can decide how to respond to it.
author: Epictetus

quote: Hold fast to the things that are good.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions but in having few wants.
author: Epictetus

quote: The willing are led by fate, the reluctant are dragged.
author: Cleanthes

quote: Better to be silent and be thought foolish than to speak and remove all doubt.
author: Zeno of Citium

quote: Freedom is secured not by the fulfilling of one's desires, but by the removal of desire.
author: Epictetus

quote: Courage leads to heaven; fear leads to death.
author: Seneca

quote: Do not try to seem wise to others.
author: Epictetus

quote: The greatest remedy for anger is delay.
author: Seneca

quote: Only time can heal what reason cannot.
author: Seneca

quote: He who has peace of mind disturbs neither himself nor another.
author: Epicurus

quote: Be a friend to yourself and you will never be alone.
author: Seneca

quote: True happiness is to enjoy the present without anxious dependence on the future.
author: Seneca

quote: Let silence be your goal for the most part; say only what is necessary.
author: Epictetus

quote: If you wish to be loved, love.
author: Seneca

quote: No evil is honorable; but death is honorable; therefore death is not evil.
author: Zeno of Citium

quote: Difficulty is what wakes up the genius.
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb (Stoic-inspired)

quote: Wealth is the slave of the wise and the master of the foolish.
author: Seneca

quote: Remember: matter, how tiny your share of it. Time, how brief and fleeting your allotment. Fate, how small a role you play in it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: A man’s worth is no greater than his ambitions.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Kindness is invincible, provided it is sincere.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: To understand the true quality of people, you must look into their minds, and examine their pursuits and aversions.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Nothing happens to anyone that he cannot endure.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The ultimate power in life is to be completely self-reliant.
author: Epictetus

quote: A man should remove not only unnecessary acts but unnecessary thoughts as well.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: It is the nature of the wise to resist pleasures, but the foolish to be a slave to them.
author: Epictetus

quote: We cannot choose our external circumstances, but we can always choose how we respond to them.
author: Epictetus

quote: Think of yourself as dead. You have lived your life. Now take what’s left and live it properly.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: How ridiculous and how strange to be surprised at anything which happens in life.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Let no act be done without purpose.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the universe.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Be content with what you are, and wish not to change; nor dread your last day nor long for it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Remember that very little is needed to make a life happy.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Consider that before long you will be nobody and nowhere.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: If it is endurable, then endure it. Stop complaining.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: No man is disturbed by things, but by his opinion about things.
author: Epictetus

quote: If you want to be unstoppable, let go of needing others’ approval.
author: Epictetus

quote: Make the mind stronger than the circumstance.
author: Epictetus

quote: Remember that you are an actor in a drama, of such a kind as the author pleases.
author: Epictetus

quote: When you are offended, you are complicit in your own torment.
author: Epictetus

quote: Freedom is the power to live as one wishes — and the Stoic wishes only for virtue.
author: Epictetus

quote: Hold fast to your true self, for that is your unassailable kingdom.
author: Epictetus

quote: The greater the difficulty, the more glory in surmounting it.
author: Epictetus

quote: Take care not to make your pain worse than it actually is.
author: Epictetus

quote: To accuse oneself is the beginning of virtue.
author: Epictetus

quote: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
author: Seneca

quote: Anger: an acid that does more harm to the vessel than to anything it is poured upon.
author: Seneca

quote: Not how long, but how well you have lived is the main thing.
author: Seneca

quote: Cease to hope and you will cease to fear.
author: Seneca

quote: Nothing is more honorable than a grateful heart.
author: Seneca

quote: He who indulges empty fears earns himself real miseries.
author: Seneca

quote: Where reason fails, anger rises — therefore strengthen reason.
author: Seneca

quote: A guilty conscience never feels secure.
author: Seneca

quote: Regard your failures as teachers, not enemies.
author: Seneca

quote: The man who learns to laugh at himself can never be truly wounded by ridicule.
author: Seneca

quote: The goal of life is living in agreement with nature.
author: Zeno of Citium

quote: Man seems to prefer to live with a false opinion rather than be cured of it.
author: Zeno of Citium

quote: We are more often frightened than hurt.
author: Zeno of Citium

quote: Sight is given to all, insight to only a few.
author: Zeno of Citium

quote: A bad feeling is a commotion of the mind repugnant to reason.
author: Zeno of Citium

quote: No loss is greater than losing your character.
author: Zeno of Citium

quote: Well-being is realized by small steps, but is truly no small thing.
author: Zeno of Citium

quote: Fate leads the willing, drags the unwilling.
author: Zeno of Citium

quote: Better to starve free than be a fat slave.
author: Zeno of Citium

quote: Steel your mind, not your possessions.
author: Zeno of Citium

quote: If you accomplish something good with hard work, the labor passes quickly, but the good endures.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: Frugality is not poverty; it is order.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: Discomfort is the opportunity for training.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: Virtue is the only true good; vice, the only true evil.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: Better to endure hardship with virtue than luxury with vice.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: Good character requires practice, just as any art does.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: To complain is to forget the value of endurance.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: A wise person is never harmed by insults.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: Let your actions say what your words cannot.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: The sun is new each day.
author: Heraclitus

quote: Much learning does not teach understanding.
author: Heraclitus

quote: You must expect the unexpected.
author: Heraclitus

quote: The soul is dyed the color of its thoughts.
author: Heraclitus

quote: To know your darkness is the best method for dealing with the darkness of others.
author: Heraclitus

quote: No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it’s not the same river and he’s not the same man.
author: Heraclitus

quote: The road up and the road down are the same road.
author: Heraclitus

quote: The character of a man is his guardian spirit.
author: Heraclitus

quote: What opposes unites, and the finest harmony is born of things that differ.
author: Heraclitus

quote: The eyes are more exact witnesses than the ears.
author: Heraclitus

quote: Excellence is not an act but a habit.
author: Aristotle (Stoic-influential)

quote: Patience is bitter, but its fruit is sweet.
author: Aristotle

quote: The energy of the mind is the essence of life.
author: Aristotle

quote: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Aristotle

quote: To avoid criticism: say nothing, do nothing, be nothing.
author: Aristotle

quote: He who fears he will suffer already suffers from his fear.
author: Montaigne (Stoic-influenced)

quote: The greatest thing in the world is knowing how to belong to oneself.
author: Montaigne

quote: We can be knowledgeable with other men's knowledge but we cannot be wise with other men's wisdom.
author: Montaigne

quote: There is no more notable quality in the world than gentleness.
author: Montaigne

quote: To be calm is the highest achievement of the self.
author: Zen Proverb (Stoic-aligned)

quote: Let go, or be dragged.
author: Zen Proverb

quote: When you realize there is nothing lacking, the whole world belongs to you.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: He who conquers others is strong; he who conquers himself is mighty.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: Mastering others is strength. Mastering yourself is true power.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: Care about what others think and you will always be their prisoner.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: Respond to anger with virtue.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: Silence is a source of great strength.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: A wise man adapts himself to circumstances, as water shapes itself to the vessel that contains it.
author: Chinese Proverb (Stoic-aligned)

quote: The mind that is anxious about future events is miserable.
author: Seneca

quote: He who does not prevent a crime when he can, encourages it.
author: Seneca

quote: Prosperity unbruised cannot endure a single blow.
author: Seneca

quote: It is the power of the mind to be unconquerable.
author: Seneca

quote: If you wish to live for yourself, you must first live for others.
author: Seneca

quote: Nothing is more disgraceful than insincerity.
author: Seneca

quote: Remember that grief does not change the past.
author: Seneca

quote: We are born for mutual assistance.
author: Seneca

quote: When the soul is straight, so is the life.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: To love even those who wrong you is to rise to the level of the gods.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The wise man sees the future by looking steadily at the present.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Let the quality of your deeds be your shield.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Enough of this miserable whining—live as though you were to live no more.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: To accept without arrogance and let go without regret—that is mastery.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Take the shortest route: the one that leads straight to reason.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Look inward; within is the fountain of good.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: What stands in the way is often your own opinion.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: No man is hurt but by himself.
author: Diogenes Laërtius (Stoic tradition)

quote: He has the most who is content with the least.
author: Diogenes

quote: I threw away my cup when I saw a child drinking from his hands.
author: Diogenes

quote: The foundation of every state is the education of its youth.
author: Diogenes

quote: The only true possession is virtue.
author: Diogenes

quote: You become what you give your attention to.
author: Epictetus

quote: Remember: the door is always open if you wish to be free.
author: Epictetus

quote: It is better to live with courage than to die with fear.
author: Epictetus

quote: Be moderate in speech and action.
author: Epictetus

quote: Nothing but opinion is the source of disturbance.
author: Epictetus

quote: Do not explain your philosophy. Embody it.
author: Epictetus

quote: He who is wise does not grieve for the things he cannot control.
author: Epictetus

quote: A ship should not ride on a single anchor, nor life on a single hope.
author: Epictetus

quote: To accuse others is ignorance. To accuse oneself is wisdom.
author: Epictetus

quote: The beginning of liberation is the ability to see your own ignorance.
author: Epictetus

quote: The good man is unshaken by fortune, unbroken by pain.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: Self-control is the highest form of freedom.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: To live rightly is to suffer rightly.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: If you want a noble mind, you must practice noble deeds.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: Pleasure is not the good; virtue is.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: Better to be wronged than to do wrong.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: Gratitude is the mark of a good soul.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: The wise man takes responsibility, not excuses.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: A disciplined life leads to a free soul.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: Greatness is measured by the good you do, not the praise you receive.
author: Musonius Rufus

quote: Nothing in excess; everything in harmony.
author: Solon (Stoic-aligned)

quote: It is not the oath that makes us believe the man, but the man the oath.
author: Aeschylus

quote: He who learns must suffer.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Happiness is a choice that requires effort at every moment.
author: Aeschylus

quote: To know what you know and what you do not know—that is wisdom.
author: Confucius (Stoic-aligned)

quote: The noble-minded are calm and steady; the small-minded are always anxious.
author: Confucius

quote: The superior man blames himself; the inferior man blames others.
author: Confucius

quote: He who conquers himself is the mightiest warrior.
author: Confucius

quote: Silence is a true friend who never betrays.
author: Confucius

quote: The obstacles we face are the path we must walk.
author: Cleanthes

quote: Virtue is the only true wealth.
author: Cleanthes

quote: Hold fast to reason like a sailor to his mast.
author: Cleanthes

quote: Lead me, Zeus, and you, Fate, wherever your decrees have assigned me.
author: Cleanthes

quote: He who listens is wiser than he who speaks.
author: Cleanthes

quote: The chief good is the harmony of the soul with nature.
author: Chrysippus

quote: The wise man is self-sufficient, not in the sense that he desires nothing, but that he needs nothing.
author: Chrysippus

quote: Virtue is a disposition of the soul in harmony with reason.
author: Chrysippus

quote: Better to reason wrongly than to follow blindly.
author: Chrysippus

quote: The passion that enslaves you is the one you refuse to examine.
author: Chrysippus

quote: Simplicity is the greatest sophistication.
author: Leonardo da Vinci (Stoic-influenced)

quote: He who truly knows has no need to shout.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: Patience serves as a protection against wrongs as clothes do against cold.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: Time stays long enough for those who use it well.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: Where the spirit does not work with the hand, there is no art.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: Rule your mind or it will rule you.
author: Buddha (Stoic-aligned)

quote: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
author: Buddha

quote: Holding onto anger is like grasping a hot coal and expecting the other person to be burned.
author: Buddha

quote: What you think, you become.
author: Buddha

quote: Pain is certain, suffering is optional.
author: Buddha

quote: The greatest battle is fought within.
author: Unknown (Stoic-aligned)

quote: Calm is a superpower.
author: Unknown

quote: Your emotions are not commands.
author: Unknown

quote: Strength grows in the quiet moments of discipline.
author: Unknown

quote: A clear mind cuts through any storm.
author: Unknown
